poem:
**Inheritance**

In the echo of corridors, whispers of wheels  
reclaim spaces—once sealed deals  
in marble lobbies, soft-lit glare.  
A breath of public air unsettles the rooms,  
sterile once in private bloom.  
Now, heartbeats pulse through the turning tide,  
where the NHS flows in hope-pride,  
and hands meet for healing, side by side.

However, in 2002, for £37.5m, the Scottish executive bought a large private hospital in Clydebank, built in 1994 at a cost of £180m by a US healthcare firm, for the NHS. Now". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
